subject: DAPI-323: Add support for async calls in pipeline DAPI-332: hard-filter-setup and hard-filter-running are overly paranoid about passed server arg Reviewed by: Pedro P. Candel <pedro@joyent.com>
commitMessage:
DAPI-323: Add support for async calls in pipeline
DAPI-332: hard-filter-setup and hard-filter-running are overly paranoid about passed server arg
Reviewed by: Pedro P. Candel <pedro@joyent.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: CI-Testing+1

"make check" passed ok

Patch Set 2: CI-Testing+1

"make check" passed ok
Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.

Patch Set 3:

(55 comments)

Wow man, this is huge! More or less the issues are the same through the whole review: missing assertions, superfluous return statements, outdated copyright notice ... Lots of files to modify!

Patch Set 4: CI-Testing+1

"make check" passed ok

Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Thanks for taking a look, man. :)

I did all your suggestions except for the "return" elimination and the asserts in allocator.js. There are some missing asserts which you noted which haven't been added to CR 524 yet, which I'll do when I get to it.
Change has been successfully merged by Marsell Kukuljevic
You can safely skip return here and just left `cb(null, servers, {});` I think

I think I'll pass on this particular change. As a rule, I always stuff a return on the same line as a callback, to ensure I don't end up with potentially confusing bugs. I don't think removing it is worth the future risk. :)
Same here, un-needed return statement given you're calling the callback here as the final function statement
Ditto here. Not sure if you have that flag of "always return a value set" though
I'd assert vm is an object before calling one of its properties here. You can always reach that "cannot call foo of undefined" thing
Same here. Ensure there's a "vm" object before calling properties on it
Same thing again. Ensure "vm" is defined and it's an object before calling its properties
You're calling constraints.vm properties and constraints.defaults properties. I'd add an assert.object() for both right above the other assertions
Missing assert.object assertion for constraints.defaults IMO
Missing assert.object assertion for img or constraints.img at the top of the function
Can we assume that, at this point, every server will be an object which is not null?
No need for the return keyword here
This is exactly the kind of function I asked for into the previous file. is it being called before the previous one? If so, ignore my comment on the previous file
Wouldn't these be good candidates for assertions too? constraints.vm, constraints.pk, constraints.img
Same reasoning here regarding assertion for constraints.defaults
Shouldn't you consider the Copyright to 2016 or even 2017 now that you're modifying pretty much all the files?
Missing assertion for constraints.defaults. Also for constraints.pkg below
Same missing assertions than on the previous files
Same missing assertions and the final return thing
Should assert object constraints.vm before checking for the uuid, though
Good catch. I checked before changing, and assertions are added in https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/524
